In my view, no member can uphold their oath of office without calling for a full airing of the facts at hand. I urge all of my colleagues to think carefully about how history would judge a sham process designed by the person standing trial.

A just outcome is only possible if the trial itself is just, meaning the Senate must have access to all of the facts, be able to call all necessary witnesses and subpoena all necessary documents to get the fullest picture of the events for which Donald Trump has been impeached.

A senator has no weightier responsibility than to judge a president impeached for high crimes and misdemeanors. As a juror in impeachment proceedings, I intend to look at all of the evidence and vote for a just outcome, not a political one.

If these Republicans actually care about these abuses, they will stop stonewalling and join forces with those of us working to implement badly-needed reforms.
I hope those who suddenly care about FISA reform are triply concerned about ways in which the government spies on Americans by secretly reinterpreting the law and bypassing the Court altogether.

Just last year, the vast majority of Republicans in the Senate voted to reauthorize Section 702 and to prevent any consideration of badly-needed reform amendments. It’s time for Congress to reform Section 702 and Section 215 of FISA and protect Americans’ Fourth Amendment rights.

If you’re concerned about how the government gets a FISA warrant, just wait until you hear about FISA programs that don’t require warrants at all, like Section 702, and Section 215, which is up for reauthorization.

Congress must consider legislation that allows independent amici to review and weigh in on everything the FISA Court does and ensure that Americans charged with crimes as a result of FISA surveillance know about it and can challenge that surveillance.

Why after YEARS of blocking bipartisan FISA reforms are senior Republicans suddenly interested in it? There is no question that we need to improve transparency, accountability and oversight of the FISA process. https://twitter.com/jaketapper/status/1205173595028295686 …
